phrases: When I was a child, I dreamed of being a hero of justice.
What do you mean, dreamed?
Did you give up?
Yes, unfortunately...
Being a hero is a limited-time thing.
And when you grow up, it is difficult to call yourself one.
I wish it had not taken me so long to realize that.
I see.
Guess you cannot help it now, then.
Yes...
I really cannot.
Yeah.
Since you cannot, I will become one for you.
You are an adult now, so it is too late for you, but I can do it.
Just leave your dream to me.
All right.
I feel better...
Well, what was the urgent errand from Kuzuki-sensei?
I do not know.
All she said was,
I have to finish the errand Kuzuki-sensei asked me to do tonight or else.
So, Sakura-chan and Saber-chan, try to get along.
She did not go into detail.
She just left...
Jeez, she is the one who suggested you stay over, and she splits.
But it is okay.
It gave me a chance to chat with Saber-san about things.
Yes, Sakura and I understand one another.
Come on, I will be fine.
There will be a lot of people at school.
Besides, did not you say yesterday that school was safe?
Shirou, that was yesterday.
It does not mean that it is still safe today.
If you are going to talk like that, I will not ever be able to go anywhere.
Anyway, you need to conserve your mana, so get some rest.
Very well, if that is your decision, Master.
But if you run into an emergency situation, use a Command Seal.
I will.
See you later.
Hey.
What?
Do I have something on my face?
Self-Study
Student Council Room
Issei, are not you going to eat lunch?
I will eat later.
I just want to sleep now...
Hmm?
Did you stay up all night?
No, I just have not been sleeping well lately.
Issei, someone is here.
I do not care!
Tell them the student council is closed!
It is Kuzuki-sensei.
Ryuudou, I need to speak to you.
Yes, sir.
Then she has not gone home, either?
I understand.
Pardon the intrusion.
I felt I should inform you, as school is likely to end early.
Yes, sir.
What was that about?
Hey, Issei?
Well, you are not exactly an outsider, so I guess it is okay for you to hear this.
Late last night, a family called the faculty office,
reporting that their daughter had not come home from archery club practice.
Based on what they learned from the other club members,
they determined that Shinji was the last one to talk to the missing student.
Shinji?
But Shinji was not at practice yesterday.
Apparently, a first-year student forgot something at the dojo,
and when he came back for it, he saw Shinji and the missing student arguing.
We tried to confirm this with Shinji.
But he is absent today, and no one's been able to reach him.
Do not keep me in suspense, Issei.
Who is the missing student?
Mitsuzuri Ayako,
the captain of the archery team.
Did you notice anything odd about Shinji's behavior yesterday?
I am sorry, Senpai.
I have not seen him very often lately, either.
That is right.
You would not know anything.
Sorry, I should not have asked you that.
No, that is not true.
I know my brother better than anyone.
It is nothing for you to worry about.
See you.
All after-school club meetings are canceled today.
The library will also be closed.
Students with no urgent business are asked to leave school grounds at once.
I repeat...
If you are looking for Ayako-chan, she is home sick today.
Oh, thanks.
If Mitsuzuri comes tomorrow, do not mention this, okay?
Okay...
Tohsaka?
Unbelievable.
Are you crazy, coming to school without your Servant?
What choice did I have?
Saber cannot dematerialize, so I cannot bring her.
Then stay home from school.
A Master strolling around without his Servant
may as well be holding a sign that reads, Please kill me.
Emiya-kun, do you have any idea how big an idiot you are?
Idiot?
Masters do not fight with other people around, right?
So school should be perfectly safe.
Then tell me this...
Do you see any others here?
Huh?
Finally sinking in, I see.
Seriously, this morning, I went from exasperated to pissed.
After all I told him, why is he doing everything he can to get himself killed?
A Magic Crest...
Yes, this is the incarnation of the magic passed down in my family.
Simply by passing mana through it, I can invoke any spell etched here.
I have sent Archer away.
The Gandr Shot here will suffice for you.
Gandr?
Is not that just a simple Nordic curse?
That is right...
A perfectly simple curse.
W-Wait, Tohsaka!
Are you crazy?
We are at school!
If we make a scene, someone might come!
I will worry about that when it happens.
My policy is not to miss an opportunity when it presents itself.
Sorry, Emiya-kun, but I will deal with you now.
Besides, if you keep bumbling around like today, I do not think my nerves can take it.
Wait, damn it!
I do not want to fight you
Even if you do not, I do!
Just prepare yourself, Shirou!
That was Gandr?
It is different from what I know!
Are you trying to kill me?!
I thought I made that clear!
Hold it right there!
Ow...
You could really hurt someone with those things!
If you do not like pain, stand still!
I will finish you off quickly!
If they hit a vital spot, you will die instantly!
That does not sound like a mercy killing!
Shut up!
Then quit running around!
I am getting worked up because my target will not stand still!
Oh, crap...
Das SchlieBen Vogelkafig... Echo!
She put up a Bounded Field!
Fixierung, Eilesalve!
Trace on!
Huh?
She is out of mana?
So you finally came out, Emiya-kun?
Put down that silly weapon.
You do not have a chance of winning, Emiya-kun.
I will not know until I try.
Oh?
This is your final warning.
Put down your weapon, and give me your Command Seals.
At worst, I will strip the nerves from your arm, but better to lose those than your life.
No, I cannot give you the Command Seals!
That is no different from telling me to betray Saber.
I see.
I will give you three seconds.
It is your life, so it is your decision.
That is three seconds.
Emiya-kun, what is your decision?
Tohsaka, was that...
A scream?
Wait, Emiya-kun!
It looks like she is just unconscious.
She is not just unconscious!
Cannot you see she is been drained dry?
Drained dry?
Of her mana...
Her life force, if you like.
She hardly has any blood left.
If we do not do something, she will die.
Die?
Hey, Tohsaka...
I should be able to stabilize her with this gem.
Tohsaka, look out!
Wh-What is that?
Why did you...
I mean, you are bleeding...
You are bleeding badly!
D-Does not that hurt?
It hurts...
It hurts like you would not believe.
Tohsaka, take care of her.
Wha
A Servant!
She vanished?
I am surprised.
You are not going to use a Command Seal?
Sorry, I do not have many left.
Ah.
Unlike my Master, you possess courage.
In that case, I will take a different tack.
I shall give you a merciful death.
Compared to the other Servants, you are not very impressive.
You do not pack any punch.
No, this is the end for you.
You were at my mercy all along.
Now, then...
What was that amusing thing you were saying?
Something about my being inferior to other Servants?
That will not do at all.
I will start by plucking out those eyes that were so dearly mistaken.
Then I will move on to your remaining limbs.
Emiya-kun, are you all right?
W-We have to stop this bleeding!
Emiya-kun, do you have anything I can wrap it with?
Uh...
Oh, I have a handkerchief.
Sakura always prepares them for me.
Like minds, huh?
But it is better than nothing.
Together with my towel, we can make do.
So, that woman was a Servant?
Yeah.
She attacked out of nowhere.
Do not look at me like that.
I could not tell who it was, but does not that mean there is another Master here besides us?
They finally made their move, huh?
Okay, I have patched you up for now.
Tohsaka, what happened with that girl?
She is better.
I think she is out of the woods.
Oh...
That is good.
Why are you staring at me like that?
J-Just so you know, I would never do something like that!
Listen, I know.
You would never do that.
I am talking about our fight.
Want to keep at it?
Tohsaka?
I mean...
What do you want to do?
I do not want to.
Let us call it a day.
For one thing, I owe you again.
Okay, let us go.
We need to get your wound treated.
Please bear it until we get to my place.
Your place?
Put simply, there is another Master at school,
doing what was done to that girl again and again.
Why would they do that?
To win the Holy Grail War, of course.
Their plan is to sacrifice the students to strengthen their own Servant.
Are they nuts?
Who knows?
But there is already a Bounded Field around the school.
Once it is activated, everyone inside will probably weaken and die.
Emiya-kun...
Coming from me, you might reject this,
but I think we should call a truce.
A truce?
Between you and me?
I want to deal with this other Master first.
So until then, want to call a truce and help me track them down?
Well?
Personally, I think it is a good deal.
Sure, I will feel better about my chances with your help.
I am not really helping you.
We have simply agreed to a ceasefire.
But as long as you do not betray me, I will assist you, Emiya-kun.
So you are on my side for good, then.
Let us do our best, Tohsaka.
It will not be quite that long, but try to make yourself useful.
Now I understand.
You are not a legitimate heir.
Your father died before he could pass his Magic Crest on to you.
I am not so sure...
He was always against my becoming a mage.
Is not that contradictory?
Maybe.
It always seemed like Dad only taught me because I refused to give up.
In the end, he only taught me strengthening magic,
so that is all I can use.
Hold on...
Why would you tell me that?
Tohsaka?
Look, Emiya-kun, we might be partners for the time being,
but mages should always keep their arts secret.
What is the point of hiding it now?
Dad always said that magic is not something you should go out of your way to hide.
He really said that?
Yeah, I think he was trying to say to not let myself be bound by rules.
He always said to quit if I wanted to.
That is ridiculous!
Your father was no mage!
If he trained you, I cannot recognize you as a mage!
Why are you mad?
I know I cannot call myself a mage, but my dad was the real deal.
That is not what I mean.
I am trying to say...
Well...
Yeah, I do have a problem with your lack of training.
What can I do?
My old man's dead.
Yeah, that is the inherent limit of a single mage.
Mages never know when they will die, so they leave behind a Magic Crest.
I was just angry at your father for not taking the proper steps to prepare.
Magic is the culmination of lifetimes of work,
handed down from parent to child, for generation after generation.
The instant a child is born into a mage family,
that child becomes heir and successor.
That is the reason we are born, and it is what we die for.
A mage family's duty is to take the human child they gave birth to
and turn it into something else, over long years of rigorous training.
That is why your father was no mage, Emiya-kun.
He put being a father ahead of being a mage.
Is this Ryuudou Temple?
Please do not be so stiff, Emiya.
All the people in this town belong to me.
Although I am inexperienced, I am still a mage.
Next Time Mirage
If you wish to pass, then force your way through.
